newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank sets credits for Shanghai Auto/Volks jv.
newsitem.headline: China bank sets credits for Shanghai Auto/Volks jv.

text.p: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China has agreed to lend 500 million yuan to boost production and car sales of Shanghai Automobile Industry Corp, the Financial News said on Friday.

The bank has also agreed to extend 1.0 billion yuan in loans to selected sales agents for Santana cars, built by the company's joint venture with Volkswagen AG, and will extend 400 million yuan personal loans to customers to help finance purchases of Satana sedans.
The bank will make the funds available under a cooperation agreement with Shanghai Auto signed on Thursday and aimed at establishing closer financial ties, it said.
China has been encouraging state banks to link up with selected large-sized state-owned enterprises to ease their capital shortages.
The joint venture with Volkswagen, the Shanghai Volkswagen Automobile Co, produces Santana sedans.
